docs.abstract: The Turner Contemporary Gallery hosts an exhibit exploring the U.S. civil rights movement, as well as two installations from contemporary Black British artists who find inspiration in the local community.
docs.snippet: The Turner Contemporary Gallery hosts an exhibit exploring the U.S. civil rights movement, as well as two installations from contemporary Black British artists who find inspiration in the local community.
docs.lead_paragraph: MARGATE, England — When the artists Kelly Abbott and Victoria Barrow Williams heard that the Turner Contemporary Gallery was hosting an exhibition focused on art associated with the civil rights movement in the American South, they felt confused.

headline.main: Black Artists Look Beyond ‘Protest Art’ at British Shows

docs.abstract: An internist says some of the measures adopted to prevent Covid transmission may help limit the spread of seasonal flu. Also: Diversity in leadership; isolation and the elderly; policing and mentoring.
docs.snippet: An internist says some of the measures adopted to prevent Covid transmission may help limit the spread of seasonal flu. Also: Diversity in leadership; isolation and the elderly; policing and mentoring.

docs.abstract: The Rev. Roxanne Birchfield, a celebrity wedding officiant, will tell you one thing for sure: marriage is not a fairy tale but it is absolutely a thing of hope.
docs.snippet: The Rev. Roxanne Birchfield, a celebrity wedding officiant, will tell you one thing for sure: marriage is not a fairy tale but it is absolutely a thing of hope.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Rev. Roxanne Birchfield, 36, a minister of the Evangelical Church Alliance and the founder and owner of Married By Rev. Roxy, an officiating and premarital counseling service in Brooklyn, has become a high-profile officiant, performing ceremonies on hit reality shows like Netflix’s “Love Is Blind,” VH1’s “Love & Hip Hop” and “Married at First Sight.”

headline.main: Rev. Roxy Is Serious About Marriages and Helping Make Them Work
headline.print_headline: From a Celebrity Officiant, Down-to-Earth Marriage Advice

docs.abstract: The director of the Seattle Children’s Museum faced a strike and an internal inquiry after she edited staff postings, citing fund-raising and other concerns.
docs.snippet: The director of the Seattle Children’s Museum faced a strike and an internal inquiry after she edited staff postings, citing fund-raising and other concerns.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the wake of the police killing of George Floyd and the protests that followed, institutions of every kind worked to figure out what they wanted to say.

headline.main: Turmoil After a Museum Deletes ‘Black Lives Matter’ From Postings
headline.print_headline: Wary Boss Rankles Staff At a Museum

docs.abstract: One woman reflects on her path to protesting police brutality.
docs.snippet: One woman reflects on her path to protesting police brutality.
docs.lead_paragraph: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device:Via Apple Podcasts | Via Spotify | Via Stitcher

byline.original: By Michael Barbaro, Caitlin Dickerson, Lynsea Garrison, Neena Pathak, Sydney Harper, M.J. Davis Lin and Lisa Tobin

docs.abstract: A robust body of research shows the benefits of integration. Why, then, is it so hard to achieve?
docs.snippet: A robust body of research shows the benefits of integration. Why, then, is it so hard to achieve?
docs.lead_paragraph: New York City, one of the most demographically diverse places on the planet, is also home to one of the most segregated school districts in America. That contrast has rattled New York’s self-image and given rise to major integration efforts over the past several years. Most have failed. And across America, desegregation has never been tried at scale, partly because of resistance from white liberals.

headline.main: How White Progressives Undermine School Integration

docs.abstract: More than 200 said they stood in solidarity with three former co-workers who have accused the company of discrimination.
docs.snippet: More than 200 said they stood in solidarity with three former co-workers who have accused the company of discrimination.
docs.lead_paragraph: The messages used words like disappointed, disheartened, angered, upset, ashamed, frustrated, infuriated, disillusioned, deeply saddened and disturbed. On Friday, 236 employees of Pinterest, a company known for its virtual pinboards, expressed solidarity on an internal chat app with three former co-workers who have accused the company of racial and sex discrimination and retaliation.

headline.main: Pinterest Employees Demand Gender and Race Equality
headline.print_headline: Employees At Pinterest Take Actions For Equality

docs.abstract: It’s a largely symbolic document that broadly outlines the party’s agenda. It doesn’t make everyone happy.
docs.snippet: It’s a largely symbolic document that broadly outlines the party’s agenda. It doesn’t make everyone happy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats on Tuesday night officially approved a new party platform, outlining a sweeping set of policies on key issues including health care, climate change and the economy.

headline.main: What the Democratic Party Platform Actually Says

byline.original: By Sydney Ember and Matt Stevens

docs.abstract: As a Black man and a public servant, I see that spectacle is drowning out the voices that need to be heard to make positive change.
docs.snippet: As a Black man and a public servant, I see that spectacle is drowning out the voices that need to be heard to make positive change.
docs.lead_paragraph: After the horrendous killing of George Floyd, people in Portland, Ore., joined with thousands across the country in demonstrations to address police reform and widespread systemic racism. The leaders of the Portland Police Bureau denounced this tragic death, and we reiterated our willingness to engage in reforms.

headline.main: I’m the Police Chief in Portland. Violence Isn’t the Answer.

docs.abstract: Gun violence has surged this summer, and crime experts aren’t sure why.
docs.snippet: Gun violence has surged this summer, and crime experts aren’t sure why.
docs.lead_paragraph: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

headline.main: What’s Behind the Recent Rise in Shootings?
